source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Iridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J. (1994). Iridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stamens asymmetrically arranged to one side of the flower; style branches slender, 7–10 mm long, exceeding anthers by 6–13 mm; bracts deeply torn with spreading, gradually narrowing points
Stamens symmetrically arranged around the style; style branches narrowly cuneate, 3–5 mm long, shorter than anthers or exceeding them by up to 3 mm; bracts slightly torn distally
